question: [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/mode/per_issuer.rs] [Type: ConsensusSessionKey] [Pool Key Collision] Can identical session keys from different epochs at line 11 cause VTxnPoolState to incorrectly deduplicate legitimate updates? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/mode/per_issuer.rs] [Function: new_rb_request()] [Epoch Boundary] Can validators create ObservedUpdateRequests at lines 24-27 during epoch transitions that span multiple validator sets, causing consensus confusion? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/mode/per_issuer.rs] [Function: log_certify_start()] [Epoch Stale Data] Does epoch validation at line 14 prevent processing JWK updates from validators that were rotated out in previous epochs? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/mode/per_issuer.rs] [Function: session_key_from_qc()] [Epoch Replay] Can attackers replay QuorumCertifiedUpdates from old epochs at line 40 if the session key doesn't include epoch information? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/mode/per_issuer.rs] [Function: new_rb_request()] [Byzantine Broadcast] Can Byzantine validators (< 1/3) create conflicting ObservedUpdateRequests at lines 24-27 for the same epoch/issuer to split honest validators' consensus? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/mode/per_issuer.rs] [Function: session_key_from_qc()] [Byzantine QC] Can Byzantine validators craft QuorumCertifiedUpdates with manipulated issuers at line 40 that pass signature verification but contain malicious JWKs? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/mode/per_issuer.rs] [Function: log_certify_start()] [Byzantine Logging] Can Byzantine validators spam log_certify_start() at line 14 to create resource exhaustion through excessive logging? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/mode/per_issuer.rs] [Function: session_key_from_qc()] [Hash Collision] Since issuer bytes at line 40 are used as HashMap keys, can attackers create issuers with colliding hash values to corrupt the states_by_issuer HashMap? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/mode/per_issuer.rs] [Type: ConsensusSessionKey] [Hash Stability] Does the Issuer type (Vec<u8>) have a stable hash function, or can hash value changes between Rust versions break session tracking? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/mode/per_issuer.rs] [Function: session_key_from_qc()] [Move Validation] Does the issuer extracted at line 40 match the validation logic in the on-chain jwks.move contract, or can format discrepancies allow invalid updates? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/mode/per_issuer.rs] [Function: new_rb_request()] [Move Type Safety] Can the ObservedUpdateRequest created at lines 24-27 be safely converted to Move types without losing issuer information or introducing type confusion? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/mode/per_issuer.rs] [Function: log_certify_done()] [Move Execution] Does the QC logged at line 30 guarantee successful execution in the Move VM, or can VM execution failures occur after certification? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/mode/per_issuer.rs] [Function: new_rb_request()] [Clone Performance] Does the issuer.clone() at line 26 create memory pressure under heavy JWK update loads, potentially causing validator node crashes? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/mode/per_issuer.rs] [Function: session_key_from_qc()] [Clone Ownership] Can the issuer.clone() at line 40 combined with HashMap insertion lead to memory leaks if sessions are never cleaned up? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/mode/per_issuer.rs] [Function: log_certify_start()] [Clone Side Effects] Does the payload.issuer.clone() at line 17 have any unsafe side effects that could be exploited during concurrent logging? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/mode/per_issuer.rs] [Type: ReliableBroadcastRequest] [Conversion Safety] Does the Into<JWKConsensusMsg> conversion preserve all fields of ObservedUpdateRequest, or can information loss enable bypass attacks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/mode/per_issuer.rs] [Function: new_rb_request()] [Liveness Attack] Can attackers create ObservedUpdateRequests at lines 24-27 for non-existent issuers to permanently stall JWK consensus sessions? (High)
